Rarotonga sightseeing optional add-ons Koka Lagoon Cruise Enjoy a day out with Koka Lagoon Cruises exploring Muri Lagoon. Snorkel amongst the lagoon life or simply marvel at the views through the glass bottom. There is non-stop entertainment provided by the friendly talented crew from ukelele playing, pareu tying and weaving. Enjoy a delicious fish barbecue feast on Koromiri islet, watch an amazing coconut tree climbing show, coconut husking and more! Includes: Glass bottom boat tour, snorkelling equipment, coconut tree climbing show, BBQ lunch, refreshments (cordial/water) Operates: Daily Duration: 4hrs Tour only: Price from $99 per adult, $49 per child (6-11yrs) Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Tour with return hotel transfers: Price from $115 per adult, $69 per child (6-11yrs) Travel : 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Te Vara Nui Village – Overwater Night Show & Buffet Dinner This stunning show delivers an electric authentic cultural performance like no other. Enjoy delicious traditional island night buffet fusing local island tastes from world class Umukai (traditional feast) and sample the culinary skills of local and European Chefs. With compelling legend stories set over the water portraying the past and fast hip-shaking dances with resounding beats of drums and rhythms of song and dance, this spectacular setting and performance are guaranteed to lift the hairs on the back of your neck! Includes: Buffet dinner, spectacular over water night show Operates: Tues, Thurs & Sat Duration: 4.5 hours Tour only: Price from $155 per adult, $75 per child (6-11yrs) Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Tour with return hotel transfers: Price from $175 per adult, $85 per child (6-11yrs) Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Raro Buggy Tours Try this “drive it yourself” full of fun guided 4-wheel tour which takes you on an adventure around the island. Visit historical sites and stop o. at a waterfall for a quick swim before heading to a mini golf course for a few putts. Morning and afternoon tours available. Drivers must be 18 years and over. Operates: Mon-Fri Duration: 1.5-2 hours Single Driver Price from $225 per buggy Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Double Shared Price from $249 per buggy Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Aitutaki Day Tour Your excursion starts with a circle island tour followed by a cruise on the Titi Ai Tonga catamaran. Spend the day snorkelling in the spectacular lagoon, feed the fish and enjoy a scrumptious lunch. Includes flights from Rarotonga to Aitutaki. Includes: return Rarotonga airport transfers, return flight from Rarotonga to Aitutaki, island tour of Aitutaki, lagoon cruise and BBQ lunch, live entertainment by the crew, towels & snorkelling gear Operates: Mon-Sat Price from $839 per adult, $425 per child (2-11yrs) Travel: 01 Jan 26-31 Mar 27 Raro Safari 4WD Inland Tour Four wheel drive vehicles take you on a tour of the inland road and to the heights of Rarotonga for breathtaking scenery. Designed for the more agile passenger, during this tour there is a professional guide commentary on various traditional uses of the local fauna and floral. Passengers are treated to sights and sounds that normal visitor traffic would not get to experience. Includes: return hotel transfers & tour Operates: Mon-Fri Duration: 3hrs Price from $105 per adult, $55 per child (6-11yrs) Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Ocean Toa Turtle Tours Explore the hidden gems of Rarotonga, Cook Islands on this 1½ hour guided snorkel tour, both within the lagoon and beyond the reef. Get up close and personal with turtles. You’ll see also eagle rays and reef fish and plenty of coral life. Includes: 1.5 hour guided tour with experienced & certified guards, quality snorkel gear provided , edited photos & video and fresh fruit platter Operates: Mon-Fri Duration: 1.5 hours Price from $155 per person Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Akura Fishing Charter – Shared Charter AKURA – 12 metre Game Fishing vessel Akura has one of the best catch rates on the island and the boys know their stuff, using a variety of lures and baits that have been proven time and time again. The crew go above and beyond doing whatever it takes to get that fish on the line. They regularly catch Tuna, Marlin, Wahoo, Mahi Mahi and a few other species occasionally like Sailfish, Giant Trevally and Barracuda. Some fish are seasonal. Come and experience the beautiful waters, stunning views and incredible fishing Rarotonga has to offer – their mission is to get you on that fish of a lifetime. Includes: Bottled water, sandwiches for lunch & refreshments, all gear, crew and bait and chilli bin with ice for any drinks or beers you want to bring onboard Duration: 4 hours Price from $319 per person Travel: 01 Apr 25-31 Mar 26 Terms & Conditions Sales to 21 Nov 25 or until sold out.
